text: Baccharis wrightii is a North American species of shrubs in the aster family known by the common name Wright's baccharis or false willow.Flora of North America, Wright’s baccharis or false willow, Baccharis wrightii A. Gray, Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. 3(5): 101. 1852. It is native to northern Mexico (Chihuahua, Coahuila, Durango, Sonora)Tropicos, specimen listing for Baccharis wrightii A. Gray and the southwestern and south-central United States (Arizona, New Mexico, Texas, Oklahoma, Kansas, Colorado, Utah).Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution mapGreat Plains Flora Association. 1986. Flora of the Great Plains i–vii, 1–1392. University Press of Kansas, Lawrence. Baccharis wrightii is a shrub up to 80 cm (32 inches) tall, the branches woody only at the bases. Flowering heads are usually borne one at a time on the ends of branches. The species grows on dry, sandy plains. ==References== wrightii Category:Flora of North America Category:Plants described in 1852
